entry.title:
Tests are failing: safe_browsing_blocking_page_test.cc(3703): Expected equality of these values:
 tracker->PendingCheckersSizeForTesting()
 Which is: 0
 1u
 Which...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): safe_browsing_blocking_page_test.cc(3703): Expected equality of these values:\n tracker->PendingCheckersSizeForTesting()\n Which is: 0\n 1u\n Which is: 1
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest.PostCommitInterstitialProceedAfterPreCommitInterstitial/CheckCompleteAfterNavigationFinish.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest.WarningShownBetweenProcessResponseAndFinishNavigation - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest.PostCommitInterstitialProceed/CheckCompleteAfterNavigationFinish.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest.PostCommitInterstitialDontProceed/CheckCompleteAfterNavigationFinish.1 - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/SafeBrowsingBlockingPageAsyncChecksTimingTest.SecurityStateDowngradedForPostCommitInterstitial/CheckCompleteAfterNavigationFinish.0
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/fe9f8e1517c91cf203a53185e96aad70
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Opaque Response Blocking (ORB) should be applied to sandboxed iframes
entry.content: ORB should be applied to sandboxed iframes. This bug entails either (i) verifying this is already the case (and adding any necessary tests), or (ii) enabling ORB for sandboxed iframes if it isn't already.

entry.title: MacOS and possible ChromeOS session data isn't accurate
entry.content: During local testing and looking at session data metrics (https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/timeline_v2?sid=2c5cecdf34f2fdf5affb8abb767b348f), the data looks incorrect for MacOS and ChromeOS. This is being used in UserEducation 2.0 and could cause issues throttling IPHs.

entry.title: an extra source or entry can be removed during purges
entry.content:
It's possible for the purge logic to remove a single unintended source or entry. This is caused by the code; https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/ukm/ukm_service.cc;l=132-133;drc=1701fd99b91dd2ea8deb3d8744a0bbffc36d02fa
An example case is where you're purging App sources and you have the following sources in the following order:
App1 Navigation1 Navigation2
The currently logic will cause Navigation1 to be erroneously pruned, leaving only Navigation2.

entry.title: CanAccessDataForOrigin should correctly isolate data from sandboxed iframes
entry.content: ChildProcessSecurityPolicy::CanAccessDataForOrigin should prevent a process for a sandboxed iframe from accessing data from an origin, even if the origin matches the document loaded in the sandboxed frame. Once sandboxed, a frame is considered to have an opaque origin, and shouldn't have access to things like cookie, passwords, local storage, postMessage, etc. that are associated with the original origin.

entry.title: Help
entry.content: Help

entry.title: Block reloading the same URL on PDF frames
entry.content:
For context: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5174594/comments/c6eeeb27_1931b07c
If a frame navigates to the same URL, or reloads using something like window.location = '', then the navigation attempt is allowed.
If the extension frame reloads, then it will say the PDF failed to load. This is because there was no stream added.
If the PDF content frame reloads, then it will create a nested PDF viewer.

entry.title: Problem with some animations (for ex. slide animation with ease out effect) on Chrome and Firefox
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Test it with embed code on any test web page 2. 3.
# Problem Description Ads served on web pages has some animations. On a large page, when scroll to the ads, layers with animations doesn't work well when the ads are displayed in viewport. If the ads remain in viewport, the animations are playing normal on repeating. If we scroll again, and the ad is disappearing from viewport and then we scroll back, the issue happens again.
# Summary Problem with some animations (for ex. slide animation with ease out effect) on Chrome and Firefox
# Additional Data Category: JavaScript \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Split histograms for HTTP error code and status on presence of context ID
entry.content:
Let's split the HTTP error code and status histograms into two cases: context ID and no context ID. Relevant histograms that already exist:
* PrivacySandbox.AggregationService.ReportSender.HttpResponseOrNetErrorCode * PrivacySandbox.AggregationService.ReportSender.Status
Because context IDs are a Private Aggregation concept, they should probably be nested under PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation like so:
* PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation.ContextID.HttpResponseOrNetErrorCode * PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation.ContextID.Status * PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation.NoContextID.HttpResponseOrNetErrorCode * PrivacySandbox.PrivateAggregation.NoContextID.Status
The current histograms are recorded in [AggregatableReportSender::OnReportSent()](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/aggregation_service/aggregatable_report_sender.cc;l=177-186;drc=fb04fb8b4eb9eb3b44e3946e3f17eda34efda0a3), so we know that we have the error code and status there. We still need to join that info up with whether there's a context ID. Perhaps we can plumb the error code and status back to the Private Aggregation implementation via the callback invoked at the end of OnReportSent().

entry.title: IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern.GetIAccessible() returns null
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Run Chrome Canary (v123 or greater) with the UiaProvider feature enabled : `chrome.exe --enable-features=UiaProvider` 2. Run the console application (`.\NewUIAAccessibilityTree\bin\Debug\net6.0\NewUIAAccessibilityTree.exe` or via source code) 3. Focus any field in Chrome
Actual Result `IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern.GetIAccessible()` returns null for each UIA Element received via `IUIAutomation.AddFocusChangedEventHandler`
Expected Result `IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern.GetIAccessible()` returns corresponding IAccessible element
# Problem Description `IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern.GetIAccessible()` returns null for each UIA Element received via `IUIAutomation.AddFocusChangedEventHandler` in the latest Chrome Canary (v123) with the UiaProvider feature turned on. If the UiaProvider feature is OFF - it works as expected.
Please find attached the simple application (NewUIAAccessibilityTree.zip) that can help you reproduce the issue. Source code is available, built exe file is located in `.\NewUIAAccessibilityTree\bin\Debug\net6.0\NewUIAAccessibilityTree.exe` The application subscribes to `IUIAutomation.AddFocusChangedEventHandler` and executes the following function for each focused `IUIAutomationElement uiaElement` (C# code):
``` var legacyIAccessiblePatternObject = uiaElement.GetCurrentPattern(UIA_PatternIds.UIA_LegacyIAccessiblePatternId); // 10018 if (legacyIAccessiblePatternObject != null) { if (legacyIAccessiblePatternObject is IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern legacyIAccessiblePattern) { Console.WriteLine("IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern is not NULL"); var accessible = legacyIAccessiblePattern.GetIAccessible(); if (accessible == null) { Console.WriteLine("IAccessible is NULL"); } else { Console.WriteLine("IAccessible is NOT NULL. accessible.accName: " + accessible.accName[0]); } } } ```
When you focus on any content in the Chrome Canary (v123) with the UiaProvider feature ON - `accessible ` is NULL and the application outputs "IAccessible is NULL".
Here's the output for Chrome Canary (v123) with the UiaProvider ON:
``` -------------------- Focus changed. Application process id: 30456 UIAElement.RuntimeId: 42-2623530-4-7-1-1; UIAElement.CurrentName: Search Wikipedia IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern is not NULL IAccessible is NULL
-------------------- Focus changed. Application process id: 30456 UIAElement.RuntimeId: 42-2623530-4-7-1-3; UIAElement.CurrentName: EN IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern is not NULL IAccessible is NULL
-------------------- Focus changed. Application process id: 30456 UIAElement.RuntimeId: 42-2623530-4-7-1-1312; UIAElement.CurrentName: Search IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern is not NULL IAccessible is NULL
```
Here's the output for Chrome Canary (v123) with the UiaProvider OFF:
``` -------------------- Focus changed. Application process id: 25392 UIAElement.RuntimeId: 42-2428044-4--1050; UIAElement.CurrentName: Search Wikipedia IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern is not NULL IAccessible is NOT NULL. accessible.accName: Search Wikipedia
-------------------- Focus changed. Application process id: 25392 UIAElement.RuntimeId: 42-2428044-4--1099; UIAElement.CurrentName: EN IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern is not NULL IAccessible is NOT NULL. accessible.accName: EN
-------------------- Focus changed. Application process id: 25392 UIAElement.RuntimeId: 42-2428044-4--964; UIAElement.CurrentName: Search IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern is not NULL IAccessible is NOT NULL. accessible.accName: Search
```
P.S. This issue is discovered while testing https://issues.chromium.org/issues/323708865, you can find additional details there.
# Summary IUIAutomationLegacyIAccessiblePattern.GetIAccessible() returns null
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: When downloading apps from play store "Something went wrong at our end. Try again later."
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open play store on Android and go to "manage apps & devices", then select "manage" and open "not installed" menu 2. Delete any non-installed app 3. Go back and search that deleted app and try to reinstall again, it won't install and show the error message "Something went wrong at our end. Try again later."
# Problem Description When attempting to download some (not all) apps on the Google Play Store, as soon as I try to download I get an error message that reads "Something went wrong on our end. Please try again". I tried all available proposed fixes: Clearing Cache/Data from Play Services and Store, restarting phone, checking storage and wifi connection, using a different wifi, but still no luck. However it only seems to happen with the "not installed apps" that were previously manually deleted from that list. If I try to reinstall them I get the error message.
# Summary When downloading apps from play store "Something went wrong at our end. Try again later."
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

see https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/devtools-frontend/src/test/interactions/goldens/linux/performance/bottomUp.png;drc=113812daeaf5872e5c726ad9e5ec099af7397f5a
or several other screenshots in https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/devtools-frontend/src/test/interactions/goldens/linux/performance/ which have data within a table. The font-size is suspiciously (and incorrectly) too large.

entry.title: Update call sites to use net::CookiePartitionKey::FromWire to ensure correct values get used
entry.content: New parameter, net::AncestorChainBit has been added to the net::CookiePartitionKey::FromWire. Update all the call sites to ensure the correct values get used to create CookiePartitionKeys

entry.title: Shared storage API not available in Chrome 119
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Follow https://shared-storage-demo.web.app/ and set Privacy Sandbox Ads APIs to enabled in chrome://flags 2. Add https://shared-storage-demo-content-producer.web.app,https://shared-storage-demo-publisher-a.web.app under chrome://flags/#privacy-sandbox-enrollment-overrides and enable the flag Note: could be that this is not required anymore, as this step is not mentioned on https://developers.google.com/privacy-sandbox/relevance/shared-storage#try-the-shared-storage-api 3. Go to https://shared-storage-demo-publisher-a.web.app/third-party-write (it's one of the links from the demo page) 4. The page indicates that Shared Storage API is not enabled in your browser
# Problem Description Hello We expect that the Shared Storage API is shipped in Chrome 117+ and working as documented on https://developers.google.com/privacy-sandbox/relevance/shared-storage https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Shared_Storage_API https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkletSharedStorage/get https://shared-storage-demo.web.app/ We find that the API does not work as intended on Chrome 119
1) Is it required to set Privacy Sandbox Ads APIs to enabled in chrome://flags to make use of this API, or can we keep the default flag setting in Chrome 117+ ? 2) Can you confirm if the API is available and working in Chrome 119? If so what changes are required to make the https://shared-storage-demo.web.app/ demo work ? 3) With Chrome 117 we are able to call successfully a window.sharedstorage.set , but so far, using above samples, we have an undefined error when trying the get method.
Note: this thread is split from https://issues.chromium.org/issues/40937133?pli=1 at the request of Ari. It was mentioned that https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/QWC8SnyOdzI/m/qlHZmIuRBQAJ may have impacted the API behaviour.
Thanks in advance for your help,
KR, Gilles
# Summary Shared storage API not available in Chrome 119
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Storage
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5296340 is a clang-only roll attempt (though it re-builds rust, bindgen, etc. at the new llvm revision)
bindgen crashes on mac hosts, with no stderr, e.g. from https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/try/mac-rel/1681833/overview
``` FAILED: gen/build/rust/tests/bindgen_test/c_lib_bindgen.rs python3 ../../build/rust/run_bindgen.py --exe ../../third_party/rust-toolchain/bin/bindgen --header -fcolor-diagnostics -fmerge-all-constants -fcrash-diagnostics-dir=../../tools/clang/crashreports -mllvm -instcombine-lower-dbg-declare=0 -mllvm -split-threshold-for-reg-with-hint=0 -ffp-contract=off -runtime-counter-relocation=true -mllvm -limited-coverage-experimental=true -fvisibility=hidden -Xclang -add-plugin -Xclang find-bad-constructs -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ref-template-as-trivial-member -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-stack-allocated -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-allow-auto-typedefs-better-nested -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-raw-ptr-to-stack-allocated -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang disable-check-raw-ptr-to-stack-allocated-error -Xclang entry.title: Attach extra debug info to reconcilor requests
entry.content: Surface the reconcilor reason requests to a.g.c to facilitate debugging. It can be either a new URL param (e.g, rr) with reconcilor reason as an enum value, or append to the source URL param.

entry.title: Dynamically updated CSSRules via CSSStyleSheet-objects fails to propagate/render sometimes.
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open index.html 2. Wait 1 second, the "foobar/default"-box will become purple. 3. If the button doesn't have purple text after a few seconds, refresh and try again (it's 50/50). 4. If the button shows purple, open devtools, select the box with the purple text and toggle some random CSS-attribute (e.g. "cursor"). The styling will now update/propagate and the box will correctly become white again.
(you can run "npc ci && npm run dev" to build the bundle yourselves from the source)
# Problem Description The script renders a white box ("foobar/default") a bit to the right with text that is styled dynamically using CSSStyleSheet. This stylesheet is updated three times, first to set it to white, second to remove all the CSS-rules (making it purple), then adding them back (making it white again).
However, a lot of the time the propagated/rendered styles lag behind, so it shows as "white->white->purple" instead of "white->purple->white" as it should. If you check the console you will see log statements separated by "-------" showing the status at each change. It shows the cssText that was used, number of styles in the CSSStyleSheet at that moment, and then a reference to the CSSStyleSheet.cssRules so you can easily inspect it yourself.
It's hard to reduce the scripts further because the more I remove the lower the frequency of the bug triggering. I was not able to reproduce it from scratch.
# Summary Dynamically updated CSSRules via CSSStyleSheet-objects fails to propagate/render sometimes.
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue Breaks in Microsoft Edge as well. Works in Firefox. So it seems to be a blink/chromium bug.
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: When batch size is smaller than low-water mark, don't immediately request more
entry.content:
Currently if we get a batch of tokens and the total number of tokens is still below the cache low-water mark, the token cache manager will immediately request more tokens. This could be a problem if the server begins handing out fewer tokens in order to reduce load somewhere -- Chrome would basically defeat that effort.
Instead, we could back off somewhat in this situation, although it's unclear what a good backoff time would be.

entry.title: Autofill passwords for nytimes.com login page not working on iOS
entry.content:
**Platform:** iOS
**URL** https://nytimes.com
**Issue**
Nytimes.com has a two page login. First it asks for username and then a password. When user tries to autofill the username by selecting the username pill, autofill does not work.
**Root cause**
This is happening because the login page contains a hidden password field which is marked as `readonly`. When we try to autofill, we are trying to do both username and password. Since the password field is marked as readonly, we are not able to autofill the password field and we fail to fill the username as well.
**Proposal**
Consider relaxing the check in following file for iOS and allow filling in just the username even if we are not able to fill the password.
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/password_manager/ios/resources/password_controller.js;l=299?q=password_controller.js

entry.title: Perf panel Screenshots have wildly changing timestamp values
entry.content:
I was using chrome:inspect to remote inspect an Android device:
Local device: Google Chrome 123.0.6301.2 (Official Build) canary (x86_64) Revision ca75e649f281129e5f6340bfcc7be8d855e9d8d6-refs/branch-heads/6301@{#4} OS macOS Version 14.3 (Build 23D56)
Remote device: GoogleChrome: 122.0.6261.43 (Official Build) (64-bit) Revision: 1570c0819d0acc84beabfb 6e050f269a464231 d5- refs/branch-heads/6261B{#745} OS: Android 14; Pixel 8 Build/UQ1A.240205.004; 34; REL
---
I noticed that when I used the Screenshots filmstrip viewer and went forward in time, the timestamps of the screenshots would jump around (back and forward in time, see 3 screenshots )
More generally, the timestamps seem obviously incorrect sometimes. For example, I looked at two screenshots which were 300ms apart on the timeline, yet had a time value that was 1000ms apart.

entry.title: MyGoogleUI is closed but _dismissAccountDetailsViewController is still not run
entry.content:
The crash repro steps: 1- Sign in with an account 2- Open account settings -> Manage accounts on this device 3- Choose any account and choose to view "My Google UI" from the alert menu 4- Close "My Google UI" using the "X" button, it should go back to the "Accounts on this device" settings page 5- Sign out using the "Sign out" button on current page; "Accounts on this device" settings page
Current state: Crash at DCHECK(self.presentedViewController), as the _dismissAccountDetailsViewController is not null, and it'll run, but the view is dismissed when "X" button was clicked so there is no presentedViewController.

entry.title: Move index and pinned_state_change to the relevant WebStateListChange subclasses
wl_pointer.enter must never be ignored
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open chromium under KDE with ozone=wayland 2. Open two tabs and detach one so that there are two windows 3. Select some text in the first window and drag it into the tab bar of the second window. This should open a new tab with a google search for the selected text. 4. WIthout moving the cursor out of the second window, scroll in the tab that was just created. 5. The first window is scrolled instead. Similarly, all button events are processed by the first window.
# Problem Description Chromium ignores wl_pointer.enter events if a DnD operation is in progress:
``` if (self->connection_->IsDragInProgress()) { VLOG(1) << "Ignoring enter event received during dnd session."; return; } ```
However, this is never correct because this will cause subsequent pointer events (scrolling, movement, buttons, etc.) to handled as if they were sent to the previous window.
# Summary wl_pointer.enter must never be ignored
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: DevTools lags after update
entry.content:
Chrome Version : 121.0.6167.185 OS : Win10 Pro x64 22H2 19045.2251
What steps will reproduce the problem? -I don't know. I just had a problem after auto-updating.
What is the expected result? -I have a good PC Ryzen 7 5800x, 32 GB RAM, GTX 3070Ti, DevTools worked fine for a year and a half, then half a year ago after an auto update, suddenly DevTools started to lag, I noticed right away, I rolled back the PC and turned off auto updates in Chrome, and everything again worked well. About two weeks ago Chrome was updated and I did not immediately notice the problem, because the problem did not appear immediately but accumulated, after 5-10 minutes of work lags began. I didnâ€™t roll back, I thought there would be an update that would fix it. Today I updated Google Chrome myself by going to the about menu. And the problem still remains. Of course, I tried all the standard methods, cleared the cache and tried different options to enable/disable in the settings after reading on the Internet what could help, but nothing helped. DevTools need to work properly.
What happens instead? -After 5-10 minutes of work, DevTools starts to slow down a lot, the console starts to slow down, the game opened in the browser starts to slow down.

entry.title: Update call sites of partitioned cookies constructors to no longer rely on default values
entry.content: Adding the ancestor chain bit to partitioned cookies has required the constructors to change . Update all the call sites of the non-test constructors to no longer rely on default values.

entry.title: Remove default parameters from PartitionKey constructors
entry.content: Once the CLs that update the code base to use the new parameters introduced to the constructors land. Update the constructors to no longer have default parameters.
